FuncDef:
The ipv6 temporary-address limit command configures the maximum number of temporary IPv6 addresses for clients in a session group.
The undo ipv6 temporary-address limit command restores the default configuration.
By default, a maximum of two temporary IPv6 addresses can be configured for a client.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of temporary IPv6 addresses for clients.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 15. The default value is 2.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After creating a session group template, run the ipv6 temporary-address limit command to configure the maximum number of temporary IPv6 addresses for clients in the session group template.
Prerequisites
A session group template has been created.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
